application

Class StaffScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.StaffScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class StaffScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class handles the logic behind the StaffScreen GUI, besides direct database interactions
    Author:
    jarrod joshua

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItemToOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      passes a food item selected from the menu and adds it to the current working order of the currently selected table when the add button is clicked.
      void clearOrderListView()
      clears the listview of food items so it is blank by emptying the observable arraylist that populates it and then setting the items of the listview to that empty list.
      void deleteCurrentOrder()
      This launches a confirmation dialog, if ok is clicked then the currenly selected order record will be erased from the database and hence the system completely.
      void enableSearch()
      upon being called all of the user controls for searching the orders and stored orders will be enabled.
      java.lang.Double getOrderPriceTotal()
      This takes all the food items in the listview and finds the sum of their corresponding prices returning a double and displaying it on screen
      void getTableFiveOrder(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This retrives all the order components for table 5 upon a first click then allows editing of these components upon a second click of the table image.
      void getTableFourOrder(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This retrives all the order components for table 4 upon a first click then allows editing of these components upon a second click of the table image.
      void getTableOneOrder(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This retrives all the order components for table 1 upon a first click then allows editing of these components upon a second click of the table image.
      void getTableSixOrder(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This retrives all the order components for table 6 upon a first click then allows editing of these components upon a second click of the table image.
      void getTableThreeOrder(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This retrives all the order components for table 3 upon a first click, then allows editing of these components upon a second click of the table image.
      void getTableTwoOrder(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This retrives all the order components for table 2 upon a first click then allows editing of these components upon a second click of the table image.
      (package private) void getUser(java.lang.String user)
      This takes the user inut variable from the login screen and passes it to a label on the staff screen.
      void initialize(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources) 
      void removeItemFromOrder(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      removes a food item from the order listview which is highlighted or selected at the time of clicking the remove button by removing the selectd item from the observable list and then resetting the listview items to the observable list
      void retrieveAllOrders()
      This method retrieves all orders from either the stored orders or current working orders and displayes them to the table.
      void saveActivityLog(java.lang.String activity)
      This method takes a simple string describing a user activity or action and then passes it, alongwith a timestamp and the username of the logged in user, to a StaffModel method which then records an entry the manager can look at later.
      void saveCurrentOrder()
      Takes all the components of the currently selected table and its working order and then writes them to the database.
      void searchByPrice()
      This method records user inputted price values, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table corresponding to the entered range.
      void searchByWhetherOrderComplete()
      This method records a user choice of whether to look for completed orders or incomplete orders, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all corresponding orders from that table.
      void searchForComment()
      This method records a user inputted string to try and match with thecomment field of an order, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table corresponding to the entered string.
      void searchForDate()
      This method records a user choice from a JavaFX DatePicker, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table from that chosen date.
      void searchForFoodItem()
      This method records a user inputted string to try and match with the name of a food item, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all corresponding orders from that table.
      void searchForSpecialRequest()
      This method records a user inputted string to try and match with the special requests field of an order, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table.
      void searchForTableNum()
      This method records the user inputted table number, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table.
      void searchForTimeInterval()
      This method records a user time range entered in TextFields, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table within the fiven time.
      void signOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Upon clicking the sign out button the user will be taken back to the login screen and the staff screen will be hidden, activity logging will be stopped at this point until someone logs in again.
      (package private) void storeTemporaryCredentials(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pw)
      This method takes user credentials and holds them in ocal variables when switching between manager and staff screens therefore allowing activity logging even when screens are switched.
      void switchToManagerScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      upon clicking the manage button the user, if their credentials permit, will be taken to the manager screen and the staff screen will be hidden.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • saveCurrentOrder

        public void saveCurrentOrder()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Takes all the components of the currently selected table and its working order and then writes them to the database. If there is already an order for the selected database in the system all but the time of order will be overwritten. Therefore you still have the original time of the order. If the order is marked as complete then the record will be removed from the current working orders and then inserted into the stored orders so that it is in the records but out of the way of staff handling the tables.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteCurrentOrder

        public void deleteCurrentOrder()
        This launches a confirmation dialog, if ok is clicked then the currenly selected order record will be erased from the database and hence the system completely. It will not be in stored orders upon clicking delete.

      • getOrderPriceTotal

        public java.lang.Double getOrderPriceTotal()
        This takes all the food items in the listview and finds the sum of their corresponding prices returning a double and displaying it on screen
        Returns:
        double, the current price of the food items currently within the working order

        public void switchToManagerScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

      • signOut

        public void signOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Upon clicking the sign out button the user will be taken back to the login screen and the staff screen will be hidden, activity logging will be stopped at this point until someone logs in again.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • enableSearch

        public void enableSearch()
        upon being called all of the user controls for searching the orders and stored orders will be enabled. This ensures the user selects a set of orders to look at in the first place.

      • searchForTableNum

        public void searchForTableNum()
        This method records the user inputted table number, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table. All corresponding orders are displayed in the table

      • searchForFoodItem

        public void searchForFoodItem()
        This method records a user inputted string to try and match with the name of a food item, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all corresponding orders from that table. All corresponding orders are displayed in the table

      • searchForSpecialRequest

        public void searchForSpecialRequest()
        This method records a user inputted string to try and match with the special requests field of an order, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table. All corresponding orders are displayed in the table

        public void searchForComment()
        This method records a user inputted string to try and match with thecomment field of an order, and the user chice of whether to query stored or working orders, these variables are then passed it to the StaffModel methods that interact with the database to search for all orders from that table corresponding to the entered string. All corresponding orders are displayed in the table

All corresponding orders are displayed in the table

All corresponding orders are displayed in the table
